A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Visually stunning. Writing was a bit "how're ya going" though. 

Chase is drawn out and a bad way of motivating the plot. Luke's character is compromised in order to further the ascendancy of Rey as the hero and protagonist\, which is poor form. Basically plot devices\, character motivations\, dialogue and behavioural choices are weak and too often clumsy in this movie.

Also\, while I loved the emergence of a strong female protagonist in Rey in the prequel\, although the fight scene with Kylo is a poor move which diminishes the merits of human effort\, this movie takes it way too far. The Ladt Jedi is a blatant female empowerment movie at the cost of its male leads\, shamefully using emotionally weak and compromised behaviour for every single male character\, with female admonishment and saviours each time to further this (Poe vs Leia\, Luke vs Rey\, Kylo vs Rey\, Poe vs Holdo\, Finn vs Phasma\, Finn vs random mechanic girl). It's pretty bad tbh.
